rose-compiler/rose.description: ROSE is an open-source compiler framework engineered by LLNL supporting program analysis and transformation at both the source and binary levels. ROSE can act as a compiler frontend for C, C++ (including applications which use UPC, OpenMP, or Cuda), Fortran, Java, Ada, and supports ELF and PE binary formats for a variety of instruction sets.
rose-compiler/rose.name: rose-compiler/rose

rose-compiler/rose-apt-get.description: all things related to supporting apt-get install rose on Ubuntu
rose-compiler/rose-apt-get.name: rose-compiler/rose-apt-get

rose-compiler/rose-archive.description: Developed at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL), ROSE is an open source compiler infrastructure to build source-to-source program transformation and analysis tools for large-scale C (C89 and C98), C++ (C++98 and C++11), UPC, Fortran (77/95/2003), OpenMP, Java, Python and PHP applications.
rose-compiler/rose-archive.name: rose-compiler/rose-archive

rose-compiler/rose-full.description: See https://github.com/rose-compiler/rose for the standard repo. This repo contains additional generated files for use with analysis tools such as DeepWiki (https://deepwiki.com/rose-compiler/rose-full ), and should not be cloned/downloaded.
